text:
This game still holds itself very well to modern simulators. It contains tire scrub, weight transfer, snap oversteer, understeer, and a litany of other things (including great engine sounds) that GT4 missed out on.

Probably still my top favourite driving simulator.
author: Steve R. Neill

However l can't never find the time to drive it (in games, maybe one day in real life) due duties. But l learned in this world, that the best is yet to come, meaning, that patience will get you everywhere and it will never hinder or let you go(leave you alone)

author: The Destati

text: Enthusia is quite a bit different from your standard racer. You have to level yourself an your cars up, you cant just grind for cash and buy upgrades, everything has to be earned. By putting yourself in more challenging situations, like using "weaker" cars, you put yourself in a position to earn more XP and level up faster. Using a F1 car to race against civics wont get you much. This in turn raises your ranking, giving you access to better cars and more tracks. It is frustrating but worth it.
author: JustinDanger

text: Ah cool, thanks for the speedy response. I'm definitely going to pick this up then, even if only for a mere dabble. You see, I've played some of the Gran Turismos and they all bored me to be honest, they aren't what I'm looking for in a racer. But this masterpiece I simply have to experience for myself. It sounds nothing like what I've heard in the GTs.
author: Oliver Holt

text:

Enthusia is a great game, on par with Grand Turismo, Massively underated.

Still great to this day, hasn't aged one bit.
